name: Drugs (HTN Emergency)
options: Labetalol - Initial 10 to 20 mg IV over 2 min; double every 10 min (up to 80 mg/dose) until target SBP is reached. Max dose: 300 mg. Continuous IV infusion: 0.5 to 2 mg/min until target reached.
Nitroglycerin - Initial 5 mcg/min; increase in increments of 5 mcg/min every 5 min to max of 200 mcg/min. Use only in patients with acute coronary syndrome and/or acute pulmonary edema.
Sodium nitroprusside - Initial 0.5 mcg/kg/min; increase in increments to achieve BP target; max dose 10 mcg/kg/min. Use for the shortest duration due to cyanide toxicity risk.
Hydralazine - Initial 10 mg slow IV infusion (max 20 mg); repeat every 4-6 hrs as needed. BP decrease in 10-30 min, lasting 2-4 hrs.

name: HTN Emergency Drugs Findings:
value: Nifedipine by any route is not recommended for hypertensive emergencies. Never give SL.
